alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:08PM EDT until further notice by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near Niagara affecting Florence, Dickinson, Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Dickinson and Iron Counties. Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Pike River near Amberg affecting Marinette County. Menominee River below Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain affecting Florence, Dickinson, Marinette and Menominee Counties. Brule River near Commonwealth affecting Florence, Dickinson, Iron and Forest Counties. Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Marinette, Dickinson and Menominee Counties. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. For the Menominee River...including Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain, Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, McAllister...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Brule River near Commonwealth. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Floodwaters are surrounding homes along Runbers Road in Florence County. Runbers Road may be closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM CDT Friday was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 04/25/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon.
